const char * what () const throw ()
 Returns a textual string describing the exception The string returned is of the form "<context> : <error description> [during <e.what>]".

class DVSHandle

Detailed Description

Base class for exceptions.

This class is intended for internal use only. All exception classes derive from this one

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

DVSException::DVSException (  int errcode,
const char * context,
std::exception * e,
char * errmsg = NULL
)  throw () [protected]
 

Standard constructor.

Parameters:
errcode   DVS driver or DVSClasses error code
context   Information on the context in which this exception is occurring - eg. the function call that caused it. NULL if no context string is required
e   The previously thrown exception. (if this exception is being raised during an exception handler). For example: 
 try {
   ...
 }
 catch (exception *e)
 {
   if (error occurs during exception handling)
     throw DVSException(error_number, context_string, e);
 }
errmsg   The error message string (that should correspond to the error code)

DVSException::DVSException (  const DVSException & e )  throw ()
 

Copy constructor.

Instantiates a duplicate of the specified DVSException object.

Parameters:
e   Reference to existing DVSException object

Note:
  • If you create your own subclass of DVSException with additional facilities, you may need to extend this constructor.

Member Function Documentation

const int DVSException::get_errnum (  )  const throw ()
 

Returns the error code for this exception The error code is a superset of those provided by the DVS driver API.

Unique error codes have been added for each type of DVSException defined in these libraries.
